section.name: The Open Source Content Repository for Java
section.p: The Apache Jackrabbit project is an effort to build and maintain an open source implementation of the Content Repository for Java Technology API (JCR).
JCR 1.0 is specified in Java Specification Request 170 (JSR-170). Work on JCR v2.0 has begun in JSR 283.

section.name: Documentation
section.p: For a basic overview and details on getting started, have a look at the Jackrabbit documentation on this site.

Jackrabbit exposes most of its functionality to client applications thought that the JCR v1.0 API. If you want more detail on the API you can browse the Javadoc or download it as a zipped package (right click and select "Save as...").
If you really want to know all the details, the best current documentation available is the JCR v1.0 specification itself.

In addition to implementing the JCR API, Jackrabbit has many extensions and administrational features that are not (yet) specified by JCR. (see Architecture Overview). You can also browse the internal Jackrabbit API in the Jackrabbit Javadocs.
